original_title: I tried to find out if the fossil I bought online was real. Then I realized I was asking the wrong question | CNN
article_summary: A buyer's excitement over purchasing a Spinosaurus tooth online for $100 turned into concern when the tooth's authenticity and legality came into question. Examined by a fossil expert at London's Natural History Museum, the tooth was confirmed as a Spinosaurus tooth but was likely illegally excavated and exported from Morocco. The market for high-profile dinosaur fossil auctions has been growing, with the sale of a Stegosaurus skeleton for $44.6 million in 2024 being a recent example.</s>
